Water is blue for the same reason the sky is blue. Blue light is more easily refracted when it passes through a medium (air or water), which makes the light coming from the water (or air) seem blue.
and yet, water by itself, is clear.

Are you sure that it really is clear. It could be possible that the water just appears to be clear because you can see through it. Has anyone ever seen water through a microscope. I have, now I only drink bottled water.
